guidelines.A: Undergraduate Students and Below are individuals in undergraduate (college) level, high school (junior and senior), vocational schools, and below at the time of registration. It is subdivided into two subcategories, A1 (for senior high school students or equivalent (such as those in vocational schools below the college level and out-of-school youth), and below) and A2 (for undergraduate (college) students and equivalent). Registrants in this category are required to send a photo/scanned copy of their school ID and latest certificate of registration (if applicable) to avail of the discount.
guidelines.B: Workers, Graduate Students, or Equivalent are individuals who have completed their undergraduate studies or its equivalent at the time of registration. It includes those who work or practice a profession, graduate-level students (master’s degree/Ph.D./Medicine/Law), and self-employed and unemployed individuals. It is further subdivided into B1 (for individuals aged 35 and below at the time of registration, i.e. within age prescribed as “youth” by World Esperanto Youth Organization (TEJO) and eligible for full membership in Philippine Esperanto Youth (FEJ)), and B2 (for individuals aged 36 and above at the time of registration).
guidelines.C: Moral Participants are individuals who will not participate in the congress itself, but want to support the congress financially. The fee is half (50%) of the regular period registration fee of category B.1 (for both Filipino and foreign participants). They shall be given due acknowledgment in the congress booklet.
guidelines.D: Congress Patrons are individuals who want to support the congress financially, besides joining the congress, by paying a larger rate than the normal rates. The fee is 250% of the Regular Period registration fee of Category B1. Congress Patrons may choose to participate physically or not, and will receive separate acknowledgment in the Congress Booklet and other related materials, as well as a special gift from the Organizing Committee.
guidelines.forMinors: Note that participants aged 12 years old and below and accompanied by their parents/guardians can join the congress free of charge, however they will not be provided their own Congress Kit (except for name tags) and must pay additional fees if they will avail of lodging, the excursion, and meals.

congressPhoto.guidelines: Through an accredited photographer, the Organizing Committee will print copies of the official memorabilia group photo of the participants of the Congress. This will only be implemented if there will be enough demand from the participants.

invitLetter.guidelines:
All participants will receive a digital copy of their invitation letters in their respective emails. However, in the case that you need documentation for various purposes, you may request a printed invitation letter from us to be sent by mail.

Invitation letters will be sent as regular mail through PhilPost. On the other hand, you want it sent using Express Mail Service (EMS) or through a private courier service, please select the corresponding option to inform the Organizing Committee. Note that you will have to shoulder any additional shipping fees (if applicable).

donate.guidelines00:
You may also choose to support the preparation of the congress even further by making monetary donations for specific purposes. Donors will be mentioned on the Congress Booklet and other related materials. Thank you very much for your donation.

Here are some items where your donations can be placed:
donate.guidelines01: Donations are optional. You can leave some or all of these blank if you do not wish to make any donation.
donate.anonymous: I do not wish to be mentioned as a donor in congress materials (anonymous donation)
donate.congressFundDesc: to augment financial resources of the congress and further cover its costs, and eventually to make the entire program richer and more substantial for all participants.
donate.participantFundDesc: to finance the participation of young Filipinos who live in areas far from the Congress venue or those who undergo financial struggles that hinder them from attending the event.
donate.associationFundDesc: to finance other ongoing and future activities and initiatives of the Philippine Esperanto Youth.
